metadata.title: CVE-2016-2318 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.23 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted SVG file, related to the (1)DrawImage function in magick/render.c, (2) SVGStartElement function incoders/svg.c, and (3) TraceArcPath function in magick/render.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1').
